title: Drawing, "Design for clock", 1800–25
medium: Pen and black ink, yellow, red watercolor, on cream laid paper
inscribed: Below left, pen and brown ink: l'amour et la fidelite, Z (?) aid/nund/ene, E.p.E.f
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Octagonal base, supported by tapered feet. Front panel shows a couple following Hymen to a circular temple. The dial is flanked by swans in profile. Cupid sits on top of the dial, petting a dog.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for clock", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and black ink, yellow, red watercolor, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-7.
